title: Man Utd legend Roy Keane destroys two Tottenham players after Liverpool defeat
text:
Roy Keane slammed two Tottenham stars after the Liverpool defeat (Picture: Sky Sports)

Manchester United legend Roy Keane blasted Danny Rose and Serge Aurier following Tottenham’s defeat to Liverpool and described the pair as ‘dumb and dumber’.

Jurgen Klopp’s Liverpool defeated Spurs 2-1 at Anfield on Sunday to maintain their six-point gap at the top of the Premier League table.

Reds captain Jordan Henderson cancelled out Harry Kane’s early opener on Merseyside and Mohamed Salah settled the affair with a 75th-minute penalty.

"Dreadful. Dumb and Dumber I'd call them." Roy Keane doesn't hold back in his punditry does he! 😄 pic.twitter.com/8tLjUfrJlM — Soccer AM (@SoccerAM) October 27, 2019

Red Devils hero Keane was critical of the performance of Tottenham’s full-backs during the Premier League clash and said: ‘They were dreadful.

‘Dumb and dumber I call them. I thought they were really poor, you cannot compare them to the two Liverpool lads [Trent Alexander-Arnold and Andy Robertson] who were absolutely fantastic.

‘The two full-backs today for Liverpool particularly going forward, okay there are parts of their game defensively they can improve but going forward absolutely fantastic and the two full-backs for Tottenham, I thought they were a joke, really abysmal.’

Reacting to Liverpool’s hard-fought victory, Reds boss Klopp said: ‘I really liked the way we played against really tough opponents.

‘It was a wonderful game of football, it’s how you wish games should be. The boys delivered. We had chance after chance and the keeper had sensational save after sensational save.

‘At half-time I said this game had only one problem – the scoreline. When Tottenham had the ball their counter-attacks were incredible. We won the game and deserved it.’
